title: COAST ORB / redchairconvo
description: The Red Chair Dialogue with Inland Empire.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "It's only a red chair. Just a red c..."
dialogueTree.english: It's only a red chair. Just a red chair in an empty shack -- with what looked like a dusty bow tie on the shelf. Nothing to see here, right?
dialogueTree.polish: To tylko czerwone krzesło. Zwykłe czerwone krzesło w pustej szopie. A na półce leżało coś jak zakurzona muszka. Nic tu ciekawego, nie?
dialogueTree.belarusian: Гэта ўсяго толькі чырвоны крэселка. Звычайнае чырвонае крэселка ў пустым хляве. А на паліцы ляжала нешта, што нагадвае запыленую мухі. Нічога цікавага, так?

links.title: You: ""Hey Kim, where are we?""
links.english: "Hey Kim, where are we?"
links.polish: „Hej, Kim, gdzie jesteśmy?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй, Кім, дзе мы?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In someone's abandoned shack. On t..."
links.english: "In someone's abandoned shack. On the coast. In Martinaise..." He looks at you. "In Revachol."
links.polish: „W czyjejś opuszczonej chacie. Na wybrzeżu. W Martinaise...” – stwierdza, zerkając na ciebie. „W Revacholu”.
links.belarusian: "У кінутай сялянскай хаце. На ўзбярэжжы. У Мартынайсе..." — зазначае, зірнуўшы на цябе. "У Рэвашолі".

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's afraid you've forgotten sudden..."
links.english: He's afraid you've forgotten suddenly.
links.polish: Przestraszył się, że nagle zapomniałeś.
links.belarusian: Спалохаўся, што раптам забыў.

links.title: You: ""What's with the red chair?""
links.english: "What's with the red chair?"
links.polish: „O co chodzi z tym czerwonym krzesłem?”
links.belarusian: "Што такое з гэтым чырвоным крэслам?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nothing. It's just a piece of furn..."
links.english: "Nothing. It's just a piece of furniture." He looks at the chair gathering dust.
links.polish: „Nic. To tylko mebel” – stwierdza, spoglądając na krzesło pokryte kurzem.
links.belarusian: "Нічога. Гэта толькі мэбля," – адзначае, гледзячы на крэсла, пакрытае пылам.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Red paint is peeling off it. Looks..."
links.english: Red paint is peeling off it. Looks like blood, no?
links.polish: Odłazi od niego czerwona farba. Wygląda jak krew, czyż nie?
links.belarusian: З яго адлузваецца чырвоная фарба. Выглядае як кроў, ці не так?

links.title: You: ""What's with the red bow tie?" (Sho..."
links.english: "What's with the red bow tie?" (Show it to him.)
links.polish: „O co chodzi z tą fioletową muszką?” (Pokaż mu ją).
links.belarusian: "Што не так з гэтай фіялетавай мухай?" (Пакажы яму яе).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's just a piece of clothing you'..."
links.english: "It's just a piece of clothing you've picked up. You do that, officer -- you collect clothes sometimes."
links.polish: „To tylko element garderoby, który podniosłeś. Masz to w zwyczaju, oficerze – czasem zbierasz ubrania”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта проста элемент гардэробу, які ты падняў. У цябе ёсць такая звычка, афіцэр — часам збіраеш вопратку".

links.title: Empathy: "He sounds a little worried. It's an..."
links.english: He sounds a little worried. It's an odd habit.
links.polish: Wydaje się nieco zmartwiony. To dziwny nawyk.
links.belarusian: Ён здаецца трохі занепакоеным. Гэта дзіўная звычка.

links.title: Composure: "Don't be worried, lieutenant. Cloth..."
links.english: Don't be worried, lieutenant. Clothes are therapeutic.
links.polish: Nie martw się, poruczniku. Ubrania mają wartość terapeutyczną.
links.belarusian: Не хвалюйцеся, лейтэнант. Адзенне мае тэрапеўтычную каштоўнасць.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "You better not fucking think about..."
links.english: You better not fucking think about ditching me for some shitty cum stained bow tie. You and I are gearing up for the *final showdown* that's gonna be off *all walls*. You wait and see.
links.polish: Lepiej nawet, kurwa, nie myśl, żeby zamienić mnie na jakąś gównianą, obspermioną muszkę. Ty i ja szykujemy się na *ostateczne starcie*, które odbije swoje piętno na *wszystkich ścianach*. Poczekaj tylko, to zobaczysz.
links.belarusian: Лепш нават, чорта з два, не думай замяніць мяне на нейкую хрэновую, аплодненую мушку. Ты і я рыхтуемся да *канчатковага супрацьстаяння*, якое пакіне свой адбітак на *ўсіх сценах*. Пачакай толькі, пабачыш.

links.title: Half Light: "Your neck tie sounds very scared. N..."
links.english: Your neck tie sounds very scared. NEVER take it off.
links.polish: Twój krawat wydaje się bardzo wystraszony. NIGDY go nie zdejmuj.
links.belarusian: Твой гальштук здаецца вельмі пераляканым. НІКОЛІ яго не здымай.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes. Agreed. You should never take..."
links.english: Yes. Agreed. You should never take your neck tie off. Ever.
links.polish: Tak. Zgoda. Nie powinieneś zdejmować swojego krawata. Nigdy.
links.belarusian: Так. Згода. Ты не павінен здымаць сваю гальштук. Ніколі.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "You took *me* off for that shit? YO..."
links.english: You took *me* off for that shit? YOU FUCKING IDIOT! Put the horrific neck tie back on immediately -- or you will miss out on the FINAL SHOWDOWN. This is your last warning. Put me back on.
links.polish: Zamieniłeś *mnie* na to gówno? TY JEBANY IDIOTO! Załóż natychmiast okropny krawat z powrotem. Inaczej przegapisz OSTATECZNE STARCIE. To ostatnie ostrzeżenie. Załóż mnie z powrotem.
links.belarusian: Ты памяняў *мяне* на гэтае лайно? ТЫ ПРАКЛЯТЫ ІДЫЁТ! Надзень адразу жахлівы гальштук назад. Інакш прапусціш АСТАТНЮЮ СУТЫКНЕННЕ. Гэта апошняе папярэджанне. Надзень мяне назад.

links.title: Half Light: "Your neck tie sounds very scared. I..."
links.english: Your neck tie sounds very scared. It's unsafe not to wear it. Put it back.
links.polish: Twój krawat wydaje się bardzo wystraszony. Niebezpiecznie nie mieć go na sobie. Włóż go z powrotem.
links.belarusian: Твой гальштук здаецца вельмі спалоханым. Небяспечна не мець яго на сабе. Апрані яго назад.

links.title: You: ""Could our suspect be staying here?""
links.english: "Could our suspect be staying here?"
links.polish: „Czy nasza podejrzana może gdzieś tu być?”
links.belarusian: "Ці можа наша падазраваная быць недзе тут?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here?" He looks around. "I don't s..."
links.english: "Here?" He looks around. "I don't see signs of recent habitation. This place is abandoned."
links.polish: „Tutaj?” – pyta, rozglądając się. „Nie widzę żadnych oznak niedawnej obecności. To miejsce jest opuszczone”.
links.belarusian: "Тут?" — пытаецца, аглядаючыся. "Я не бачу ніякіх прыкмет нядаўняй прысутнасці. Гэтае месца пакінута".

links.title: Suggestion: "See? He doesn't like the *vibration..."
links.english: See? He doesn't like the *vibration* from the red chair either.
links.polish: Widzisz? Jemu też nie podobają się *wibracje* generowane przez czerwone krzesło.
links.belarusian: Бачыш? Яму таксама не падабаюцца *вібрацыі*, што стварае чырвонае крэсла.

links.title: You: ""All right. Let's move." [Finish th..."
links.english: "All right. Let's move." [Finish thought.]
links.polish: „No dobra. Ruszajmy”. [Zakończ myśl].
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. Пачынаем". [Скончыць думку].

links.title: You: "Sounds like we need to investigate..."
links.english: Sounds like we need to investigate it, then.
links.polish: Brzmi to jak coś, co powinniśmy zbadać.
links.belarusian: Гучыць як нешта, што мы павінны даследаваць.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Investigate the blood red chair? Yo..."
links.english: Investigate the blood red chair? You're going to leave it alone, Harry. That's what you're going to do.
links.polish: Zbadać krwistoczerwone krzesło? Zostawisz je w spokoju, Harry. Oto, co zrobisz.
links.belarusian: Даследаваць крывава-чырвонае крэсла? Пакінеш яго ў спакоі, Гары. Вось, што ты зробіш.

links.title: Half Light: "You suddenly feel afraid of the cha..."
links.english: You suddenly feel afraid of the chair. It looks like blood is peeling off it...
links.polish: Nagle czujesz strach przed krzesłem. Wygląda, jakby odłaziła od niego zaschnięta krew...
links.belarusian: Раптам адчуваеш страх перад крэслам. Выглядае, быццам ад яго адрываецца засохлая кроў...

links.title: You: "[Discard thought.]"
links.english: [Discard thought.]
links.polish: [Odrzuć myśl].
links.belarusian: [Адкінь думку].
